title: EU will grant Brexit extension to give MPs more time and to avoid no deal
text:
Donald Tusk, the president of the European Council, has told EU leaders to grant an extension to the Brexit deadline after Boris Johnson said he would stop the ratification process for the withdrawal agreement.

Among the options under consideration is a three month extension until January 31, 2020, in line with the Benn Act. The extension would automatically end once the deal is ratified by Westminster and the European Parliament in a “flextension”.

The House of Commons voted to pass the Brexit bill by a majority of 30 on Tuesday night but rejected the prime minister’s three day schedule to debate it by 14 votes, meaning the October 31 deadline will be missed.

The prime minister insisted that...
description: Donald Tusk, the president of the European Council, has told EU leaders to grant an extension to the Brexit deadline after Boris Johnson said he would stop the ratification process for the withdrawal agreement.
